definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Is no substitute for showing off the core of her unique style.
sentences.chinese: 是否展露了无可取代的独特风格才是核心所在。

sentences.english: Most cases seldom present examples of absolutely perfect or totally flawed systems.
sentences.chinese: 大部份的个案鲜有绝对完美或一无可取的情况。

sentences.english: Thee comic is an ironical illustration that it is unadvisable to search for a shortcut to learning.
sentences.chinese: 漫画是一种讽刺的说明，这是不可取的寻找学习捷径。
转印过程2～3分钟，立等可取。

sentences.english: Although they are plays on words, the scholars can choose one or two of them.
sentences.chinese: 虽为游戏笔墨，但治学者或当有一二可取者耳。

sentences.english: There is no substitute for an A-team.
sentences.chinese: 一个优秀的团队是无可取代的。

sentences.english: The metric is a value that measures the desirability of a route.
sentences.chinese: 权值是量测一个路由的可取性的值。

sentences.english: But knowledge is preferable to ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 可是知识总比无知更为可取。

sentences.english: Is a disposition a recommendation in a wife?
sentences.chinese: 温和蹬性情是做妻子的可取桩郸吗？

sentences.english: Adjusting wet - paste density by adding water towards the end of the mixing was bad operation.
sentences.chinese: 在和膏后期补水调整铅膏密度是不可取的操作。

sentences.english: Not see the trees and forests reading method is not desirable.
sentences.chinese: 只见树木而不见树林的阅读方法是不可取的。

sentences.english: On balance, Timothy 's suggestion is more acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 总的说来，提摩西的建议更可取。

sentences.english: Your proposal still has much to recommend it.
sentences.chinese: 你的建议还是有很多可取之处的。

sentences.english: Imported lenses, computer optometry, immediate delivery.
sentences.chinese: 进口镜片，电脑验光，立等可取。

sentences.english: References to wealth and family background as desirable qualities were purged.
sentences.chinese: 不再将财富和家庭背景作为可取品质的参照。

definition: to be beneficial/to be good for
way of handling sth/method for making/work method/recipe/practice/CL:個|个[ge4]
course of action/method of doing sth/practice/modus operandi
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to hinder/(in the negative or interrogative) (no) harm/(what) harm
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
